\Aura\Web

\Aura\WebResponse

Retains information about the controller results for transfer to an actual HTTP response object.

Properties

$cache

$cache : bool

Should the response disable browser caching?

When false, the getHeaders() method will set these headers in its return value (note that they are not added to $headers directly):

{{code: Pragma: no-cache Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate Cache-Control: post-check=0, pre-check=0 Expires: 1 }}

When true or null, the getHeaders() method will make no changes to the existing headers.

Type

bool

See also

Tags

None found

The response body content.

Methods

setCache()

setCache(bool $flag) : void

Should the response disable HTTP caching?

When false, the getHeaders() method will add these headers:

Pragma: no-cache
Cache-Control: no-store, no-cache, must-revalidate
Cache-Control: post-check=0, pre-check=0
Expires: 1

Parameters

bool $flag

When true, disable browser caching.

See also

Tags

None found

getCache()

getCache() : mixed

Is caching turned off?

Returns

mixed —

Note that this is a ternary: true, false, or null.

Tags

None found

setCookie()

setCookie(string $name, string $value, int|string $expire, string $path, string $domain, bool $secure, bool $httponly) : void

Sets a cookie value in `$cookies`.

Parameters

string $name

The name of the cookie.
string $value

The value of the cookie.
int|string $expire

The Unix timestamp after which the cookie expires. If non-numeric, the method uses strtotime() on the value.
string $path

The path on the server in which the cookie will be available on.
string $domain

The domain that the cookie is available on.
bool $secure

Indicates that the cookie should only be transmitted over a secure HTTPS connection.
bool $httponly

When true, the cookie will be made accessible only through the HTTP protocol. This means that the cookie won't be accessible by scripting languages, such as JavaScript.

Tags

None found

getCookie()

getCookie(string $name) : array

Gets one cookie for the response.

Parameters

string $name

The cookie name.

Returns

array —

A cookie descriptor.

Tags

None found

getCookies()

getCookies() : array

Gets all cookies for the response.

Returns

array —

A sequential array of cookie descriptors.

Tags

None found

setCookiesHttponly()

setCookiesHttponly(bool $flag) : void

By default, should cookies be sent by HTTP only?

Parameters

bool $flag

True to send by HTTP only, false to send by any method.

Tags

None found

setHeader()

setHeader(string $key, string $val) : void

Sets a header value in `$headers`.

Parameters

string $key

The header label.
string $val

The value for the header.

Tags

None found

addHeader()

addHeader(string $key, string $val) : void

Adds to a header value in $this->headers.

Parameters

string $key

The header label, such as "Content-Type".
string $val

The value for the header.

Tags

None found

getHeader()

getHeader(string $key) : string|array

Returns the value of a single header.

Parameters

string $key

The header name.

Returns

string|array —

A string if the header has only one value, or an array if the header has multiple values, or null if the header does not exist.

Tags

None found

getHeaders()

getHeaders() : array

Returns the array of all headers to be sent with the response.

Returns

array

Tags

todo

Add case for cache === true (hm, or cache === array).

setRedirect()

setRedirect(string $uri, int $code, string $text) : void

Set a location that the response should redirect to, along with a a status code and status text.

Parameters

string $uri

The URI to redirect to.
int $code

The HTTP status code to redirect with; default is 302.
string $text

The HTTP status text; default is 'Found'.

Tags

None found

setRedirectAfterPost()

setRedirectAfterPost(string $uri, int|string $code, string $text) : void

Set a location that the response should redirect to, along with a a status code and status text, *and* sets caching to false.

Parameters

string $uri

The URI to redirect to.
int|string $code

The HTTP status code to redirect with; default is 303.
string $text

The HTTP status text; default is 'See Other'.

Tags

None found

isRedirect()

isRedirect() : bool

Is the response set to issue a redirect?

Returns

bool

Tags

None found

getRedirect()

getRedirect() : string

Returns the redirect location, if any.

Returns

string

Tags

setStatusCode()

setStatusCode(int $code)

Sets the HTTP status code to for the response.

Automatically resets the status text to null.

Parameters

int $code

An HTTP status code, such as 200, 302, 404, etc.

Tags

None found
